div.sent: We know that Adam and Eve were the first human beings ever created by God.
They are our original parents.
They disobeyed God.
Because, they were tempted by Satan to eat the forbidden fruit.
They knowingly disobeyed God.
Thus they committed a great sin.
Due to this sin they were severely punished.
Now we will read about the story of Adam and Eve from the Holy Bible.
Then we will learn how they were punished.
God allowed Adam and to live in a very beautiful garden named Eden.
They all lived in peace with Adam and Eve.
No one harmed the other.
God gave Adam and Eve the responsibilities to look after everything there.
He also allowed them to use those things.
He said to them, There are many fruit-bearing trees.
Dont eat its fruit.
If you eat that, you will die.
Everyday, God used to take care of them in the garden.
He loved them very much.
Satan tried to mislead them.
So, one day Satan came to Eve in the guise of a snake.
She replied, If we eat the fruit of this tree, we will die.
You will be equal to God.
So He has forbidden you to eat this fruit.
So, Eve became greedy and wanted to be equal to God.
She agreed to eat that fruit of the forbidden tree.
Satan took a fruit of the tree and gave it to Eve.
She ate it herself and gave it to Adam to eat.
Adam also ate that fruit.
As soon as they had eaten the fruit, they were given the knowledge.
They could realized that they were naked.
So they wove fig leaves together and covered themselves.
Then Adam and Eve heard the sound of God's stepping.
They understood that God was coming to them.
Thinking this, they hid behind a bush.
God called Adam, Where are you?
Adam answered, Hearing your stepping, we have gone into hiding.
Because we are naked.
God asked him, Who has told you that you are naked?
Have you eaten the fruit I had forbidden you to eat?
I have eaten it.
So He was very displeased with them.
He punished them.
He said to them, I shall increase your unhappiness and trouble.
Then God drove Adam and Eve from the Eden and sent them on earth.
What is Sin?
Conscious disobedience to God is a sin.
Yet, they were tempted by Satan.
Thus they disobeyed God and committed sin.
When one commits sin, he or she loses peace.
They had to come down on the earth.
For this sin, their good relation with God was broken.
Adam and Eve polluted their souls by committing a sin.
This pollution and sin spread among their next generations.
As a result, they lost their purity.
We are their descendants.
So, we are born with an attraction for sin.
This is called the original sin.
For this sin the door of heaven was closed for us.
Having Faith in Jesus Christ, we can recive the sacrament of Baptizm and become sacramental.
We can redeem ourselves from the original sin through baptism.
Sometimes we neglect to go to the Church and thus we commit a sin.
We do not take part in prayers either, because we do not love God.
By disobeying our parents, teachers and elders, we also commit sin.
As we do not love them, we disobey them.
To tell a lie, to steal, and to quarrel among ourselves are also sins.
All these are our ill feelings towards others.
We lose the eligibility of becoming the child of God by committing sins.
The relation of love between God and humankind is broken.
As a result sorrows and sufferings, anguish and unhappiness increase.
Thus the happiness and joy remain a far cry in our life.
We can free ourselves from sins by sacramental confessions.
Through the sacraments we get God's forgiveness and peace.
Then we forgive each other.
Thus we develop a loving relationship with God and man.
This is how we reunite with God and humankind.
